intro: Moricandia arvensis var. robusta, commonly known as field glory or wild radish, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It is a biennial or short-lived perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm. The plant features basal leaves that are lobed or entire, with a hairy texture, and produces yellow flowers in clusters. Its fruit is a cylindrical silique containing several seeds. It is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in agricultural fields.
